Further breakdown of project management costs:
- Internal - 1 day
- Client liaison - 1 day
- liaison with 3rd party - 1 day

We can also do this on a time-and-materials basis, rather than as a fixed cost. This may be cheaper, but with a risk of cost escalation if our time estimates are wrong.
Approved. Deadline moved to October 10th.

1) To retrieve the paths for the various page types:

NB: currently we have limited to 50 pages, we can easily amend this later but thought better to limit as the queries can be heavy on the CMS.

https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-news?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg 
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-blogs?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-publications?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-pressreleases?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-videos?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-transcripts?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-photos?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg

- We have kept the info at this top level "light" to save us having to load each page into memory, which is much heavier in terms of processing. 
- If more info is required then you should make a call to the page (see below)
- However is their is info that would be *really* useful to have at the high level do let us know as we may be able to include it without compromising performance. 
- Let us know if you would prefer dates is a different format etc.

2) To retrieve the actual page as XML:

https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/***the_path_to_you_page you_got_from_above_here***?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/blog/2006/12/lucky-dog-launch.php?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg

- Please note that calls to this API should be spaced out (~5 sec) to reduce undue load on the server.
- Ideally, test exports should be done with short runs (~50 pages) rather that retrieving every page of a given type every time (which could put undue load on the CMS)
- Please try and keep runs to a minimum or cache the output.

3) Comments

We have written a single API that returns all comment, a link to the original page (that this comment refers to), type of comment (blog or photo comment), post date and the name/email of the user who posted the comment. Hopefully it is fairly self explanatory.

https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/api/custom/gtw-comments?apiKey=p5tN1FrFOgcRdN4YXGAnpg

4) Images and PDF's (as of 23/11/2011):

Images: http://www.london2102.com/image-23-11-2011.tar.gz
Documents: http://www.london2102.com/documents-23-11-2011.tar.gz

Jamie, this is all fab!

I am going to send it to DeltaTre now, and I’ll let you know if they have any questions/comments.

Thank you.

Liz

Hi Tom, We can of course do it, but that pages uses one of the most widely used templates on the site, namely 'Generic hub' If we make those boxes rich text then every page that uses that template will also have a rich text areas there, there is also no going back once we make it rich text. There should be no side effects of making it rich text, the main reason we don't do it is that styling issues can creep in with rich text and the CSS for those areas may not be as forgiving of a stray html tag as the main body areas (which is designed to accept all forms of rich text markup). Long / short of it, if you need it we can do it, if it's just a "nice to have" it may be worth thinking twice about. On the positive side I think we have already converted those boxes elsewhere and haven't seem any major side effects of doing that. * I'm probably just being pessimistic, but if this does cause issues it won't on this page now where we see the issue, it will probably be in 2 months when someone pastes some text in from Word and gets a

in there that causes some odd layout in IE7. Jamie

Its something we’d like to do,

I’ll just make sure I explicitly tell the eds team to be careful on these pages.

Is it relatively simple to implement?

Thanks,

Tom

Its pretty easy to do, till it goes wrong ;-)

If your going to use it other places in future then makes more sense, just wanted to highlight the danger if it was a really small one off use.

Will try and get them changed over today.

Jamie

Hi Tom,

They should be switched over now. 

Seems to be OK

But as mentioned above, be aware that if stray markup gets into those fields other than links we may not have the correct styles for it, in the worst case it may inherit the wrong style ie. you may find that a <b> tag gets rendered in 14px bold pink or something odd!

Jamie

Jamie

Follow up from Kirsten:

Further to our earlier conversation, please let me know, when you guys do get around to looking at it, whether you'll want us to change DNS. Also for simplicity, probably best to keep the last one to directory like the others, rather than a page URL. So:

mylondon2012.com -> london2012.com/mascots
mylondon2012.com/mascots -> london2012.com/mascots
mylondon2012.com/inspireprogramme/ -> london2012.com/get-involved/inspire-programme/
Awaiting authorization to amend httpd.conf (Kirsten contacted separately).
Kieran, Kirsten has asked for the lines we are inserting into httpd.conf.

Hi Kirsten

Any news on this ?

Kavita
Kavita, we've just heard back from Kirsten who has requested details of the code change we are making. We are just gathering that information now.

Ok, we now have the rules in place on the webserver.
The following two things need to happen:
 1. Akamai needs to be configured to serve requests for (www.)mylondon2012.com. It needs to forward them to the same server cluster that serves the www.london2012.com site.
 2. The DNS for (www.)mylondon2012.com needs to be amended so that it points to Akamai.
Both of these tasks are outside of Kitsite's control, but we can happily provide more information if required.

From: Kirsten Turner <Kirsten.Turner@london2012.com>

Thanks for investigating this, but we've decided not to go ahead with this.
